definition: to substitute/to complement in the proper order/to fill vacancies progressively
to hand over/to pass on sth/to gradually increase or decrease/progressively
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.chinese: 递补选举看起来作弊了。

sentences.english: Observer Thoahlane also notes that this was a by-election.
sentences.chinese: 观察家托赫兰恩还注意到这次选举本身是递补选举。

sentences.english: I have got a vacancy, yes.
The vacancy has already been filled .
sentences.chinese: 约翰是递补这个空缺的最佳人选。

sentences.english: The position is not yet filled.
sentences.chinese: 那个职位还没有人递补。

definition: to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
to wait to fill a vacancy/reserve (candidate)/alternate/substitute
quota/number of places/place (in an institution, a group etc)
position in a ranking of names/place/rank
to abstain from voting/to forfeit/to waive one's right to vote/to abdicate
to hire (an employee)/to accept (a manuscript) for publication
to review a judicial case/to reexamine
to notify at a different time/to notify later/to give prior notice
to advertise an entrance examination for an academic institution (old)
